website_summaries.verdict: Buyers wishing to avoid the crude or morbid party games will find solace in this low-key strategy game.
pros: Games usually take 1-2 hours of playing time
Board recently redesigned with new artwork
Extremely interactive game that requires cooperation from other players
cons: On the pricier end when it comes to board games
Board can fray and bend without proper care

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! Life or Death!
customer_reviews.text: Beware! Don't try this unless you plan on getting addicted. Your life will forever be altered. You'll find yourself begging strangers to come over to play. Watching youtube videos to improve your game, bribing your children. Your spouse will become a tricky, sneaky person you hardly recognize. While you will plot ways to take over. Side effects include: less tv watching, more under the table kicking, spontaneous manical laughter, snacking while plotting the demise of your friends and family. Best fun you've had in hours!
customer_reviews.author: Katie & Tyler's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great game but even Amazon pumps out fake versions, buy this one in the store
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing game, and a great introduction to games outside of the class hasbro and Milton Bradly set. It appears that even if you get the game directly from amazon you have to worry about getting counterfeit versions. The big giveaway on my box was that the game was made in "USA of the US", which was obviously a poor attempt at saying made in the United States of America. It also had no US flag on it, like the legit version does.
customer_reviews.author: A. Neff

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Catan Box as a gift. I was disappointed to hear from my friend that there are missing pieces in the box. There were only 45 roads instead of 60, only one color roads (white) seem to be missing. Not happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hisham Siddiqui

customer_reviews.title: My family adores this game! We play by slightly ...
customer_reviews.text: My family adores this game! We play by slightly different rules: 1, we rotate the numbers every 10 minutes- outside clockwise, inside counterclockwise. 2, if a seven is rolled, the person has the choice of rolling again, or pulling a single resource card from the bank. We don't use the robber at all- it caused too much contention. 3, in order to make the games shorter (2 hours per game 😱), we only build roads leading to ports where we can trade. We kept all other rules. It's addicting: Age of Empires, almost, except without the computer or the ability to attack your enemies towns & tear them down!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: fantastic game, hours of fun for the family.
customer_reviews.text: fantastic game, hours of fun for the family. After 3 games we bought the expansion to bring in extended family. Do yourself a favor and just order both from the start. The game play is simple enough, turn based with dice to determine resource allocation. The dice bring a chance component to the game. Several different strategies to win the game. My 10 year old loves it. Gets the family off their personal electric devises for an hour or so. Looking forward to getting the other expansions to make a the "uber map" for a truly epic game.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: It's Catan
customer_reviews.text: It's Catan. If you've played it you either got it or you didn't really. It's pretty fun, seems pretty simple on it's surface. If you turn a blind eye/ear to the fantasy of occupying some magically empty land with just sheep, wood, bricks, wheat and stone to gird you it's a super fun play. Fair warning though it is a game that can move towards Monopoly-ish friendship destroying. You can get a really bad run and it sucks. If you can't take the monster hit of the dice just hating you, maybe pass.
customer_reviews.author: JT Solace

customer_reviews.title: Great game, great edition marred by low quality resource cards
customer_reviews.text: Been playing a licensed themed version called Settlers of Caanan for years and finally decided to upgrade to the full version. I was impressed with be the quality of everything in this set - nice, wooden roads and settlements, sturdy board and hex pieces, extensive time box- Except the resource cards. They're printed on light, flimsy, card stock that I was almost afraid to touch. They feel like something that would come in a happy-meal freebie. Compared to the rest of the game they stuck out like a sore thumb. In fact, I grabbed the resource cards from the Caanan game and subbed them out before we even started playing. Taking away a star due to this inexplicable quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: Annette C. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Good price but I would rather pay more for something ...
customer_reviews.text: For what I thought was a designer game. The quality of the punch outs where cheap! Good price but I would rather pay more for something that would last!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Resource based game adaptable to any genre, age, and location
customer_reviews.text: Catan is simply one of the simplest historically themed resource games around. Takes up little space (a card table size area) and only suitable for 2-4 players. Three to four is best considering the options that the game creates on its randomness. That is the charm of the game: not overly complex, simple rules and random configurations helps keep the game on a level playing field for all ages (suggest 7-8+). Can be mixed with other games (take Diplomacy theme and apply it to resourcing...likely why there is a GOT, Roman, Barbarian, Viking, etc. versions). Small enough to fit in a day-pack or book-bag and road/hotel worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert David Mcmath

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that my box was damaged upon opening..
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. I ordered this for my husband as a gift for his birthday and the game box came damaged! I actually had to tape one corner because it was ripped half way up the lid. I’ve NEVER had issues like this but today... I’m not happy. Thankfully my hubby was understanding and just happy to have this game but what if this was a gift for a friend... thankfully the game pieces were find and not damaged or misprinted like some of the other reviews stated. - maybe a damaged box isn’t so bad? Gameplay. The game is fun to play but recommend watching a YouTube instruction video to make learning the rules easier.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: One of the best games ever!
customer_reviews.text: My title says it all for me. If you like a game that really engages you toward a goal that involves strategy, comprehensive thinking, a bit of suspense and some luck, but that does make wiping out an opponent the main point of the game, then this game may be just right for you. I do wish it could be effectively payed by only two, but that's not an inherent drawback to the game. I've played Monopoly all my life, and always will, but this game is actually more interesting with many more possible outcomes. Like the old Alka-Seltzer ads use to say: "Try it, you'll like it!"
customer_reviews.author: Wallerish

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey for a board game, but 100% worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This game is totally fun. I play it with my wife and two kids (12 and 14) and it's a great level for everyone. When it comes to family game night, I like games that require strategy and maybe a little bit of luck, and I like games that have an ending in a reasonable amount of time, and Catan fits the bill perfectly. When I bought this game, I also bought 5 other games for us to play on game night, but two months later, this is the only one we've played so far. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: gobbledegoo

customer_reviews.title: You will get addicted
customer_reviews.text: Well as other reviews will tell you, don't buy this unless you plan to get addicted. This game has been so much fun. We have had it for 2 months now and we have spent hours and hours (as well as full weekends) playing this game. It is fun for the whole family. I will now be purchasing the extension pack and my mother will be buying additional expansion packs for my family and starter packs for my extended family.
customer_reviews.author: DSmith

customer_reviews.title: Every game is different and so fun!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve heard about this game for a while and finally purchased as a gift for my niece. We have SO MUCH FUN playing this. Every game is different and we spent the holidays with the 12, 13 & 15 year olds soundly beating us. It takes a second to process the trade aspect but this game is fun and challenging and a great teacher for learning strategy for trading and building and managing your resources. We are getting the expansion pack ASAP, which is the only downfall...only four can play at a time (although we played as teams). Love love love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Kristan

customer_reviews.title: Best board game I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Catan really does board gaming right, but I'll leave that alone and just say youtube it. The pieces come as advertised. Sturdy packaging. I've owned the game for approx 7 months and the only wear so far is on a couple of resource cards because a 'certain' player in the house just doesn't like getting robbed. I expect this game to last for many more years and remain just as fun as the first day we got it. The only thing you may want is to get some drawstring pouches. The plastic ziplock bags it comes with are flimsy as expected and you'll end up wanting extras.
customer_reviews.author: Derek A.

customer_reviews.title: The board doesn't connect
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a Christmas gift a few years back for our dad, but we never had time to sit down and explain how to play it together. With the pandemic shutting everything down, we finally found time to play, only to find out that the outside lining doesn't hardly connect, and if you do manage to get it to connect then the tiles don't all fit inside. We literally have to use the board disconnected on two corners in order to get the tiles in to play. Super disappointed with the quality because we have loved this game so much individually, but the game we got makes it difficult to play.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda P.

customer_reviews.title: Received a 3rd party product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this game in September of 2017 and it took me 2 years to figure out that it was a 3rd party product. I always suspected there was something wrong with it : the house colors are not as vibrant, some of the houses themselves are misshapen, the water edges don't interlock correctly. The final confirmation came when my bf got me the expansion (from Catan Studios) which had the beautiful colors and flawless houses... And I noticed that the manufacturers were different. Catan is still a fantastic game 3rd party or not; however, we ordered a new version from Catan studios, as we like the quality of Catan Studios so much more.
customer_reviews.author: Milda

customer_reviews.title: easy to learn and simple
customer_reviews.text: I've heard others talk about this game for years and I finally 'bit the bullet' and purchased one. It was well worth it. The app you download to tutor your first game is extremely helpful. The gameplay is strategic, easy to learn and simple, but it is challenging and difficult to master. This is a great family game as well for anyone over 8-10. Highly recommended by my game playing family who loves Ticket to Ride, Forbidden Island, Latice, and Carcassonne.
customer_reviews.author: C. Medenwaldt

customer_reviews.title: Quality of manufacture could be better
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, I love this board game. That said, the manufacturing of this edition of Catan is less than what I would have expected from the publisher. The cardboard is thin and flimsy, and even in arid Colorado has been subject to warping and curling which makes setting up the game more difficult than it should be. I'm making these comparisons against a friend's set of Catan which has been around for about a decade, and will probably last another. With this one, I'm not so sure.
customer_reviews.author: Kogs

customer_reviews.title: Cool Game
customer_reviews.text: My three friends and I had a terrific time playing Catan. We are in our 60's and perhaps the younger crowd learns this fast but it took us an hour and a half to get it down and then we played for another hour and a half. It's really fun ! I look forward to many more Catan nights. I also said in my rating that I am just not sure it's for "beginners." You have to really read and understand those directions. It takes a bit - I guess we were beginners. Anyway it's worth it - great game!
customer_reviews.author: K. Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Fun, challenging game
customer_reviews.text: The directions are very clear and the glossary a BIG help in learning the game. Yes, its very multi-faceted, but that keeps it interesting. The special beginners section of the directions is very helpful for your first time playing. We've played it about 4 times now and we are still learning and enjoying it very much. Our 11-16 year old grandkids enjoy playing it with us. I'm looking forward to playing it for years to come and eventually buy some of the other varieties. We did buy the extension and glad we did - You can play up to 6 people with the extension.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Assembling of the game is in bad conditions
customer_reviews.text: We love this game and we were so excited to finally buy it! The game it self is awesome but the assembling is very bad. The pieces don't fit into eachother and every time we play it messes up the game because it ends up breaking apart. 3 of our friends have the same game and al the pieces fit perfectly into eachother except ours. Also some of the "settlements" that it comes with are cut wrong. It is sad because we cannot even play it 🙁
customer_reviews.author: iulloa

customer_reviews.title: Bringing family game night back when your kids are grown!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my adult daughter whose social group enjoys getting together for game night. While I did some research and thought it "might" be a hit, I was so surprised that she already knew of the game. Its popularity gave it a huge following. We now play it as a family as well. It is strategic in nature but if you are good at reevaluating situations quickly and changing your game plan accordingly you will love this game, if not but enjoy social gatherings that involve laughter you will still enjoy this game. The directions are involved but you learn as you go. Every time we play the winner is the least expected player.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen V

customer_reviews.title: Simple, strategic and quick game
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift. Played with kids 7 and 10, they understood the game right away and enjoyed. We only played the basic rules version far and its been good. Will review the advanced level details now because its easier now. My kids love it bit each child is diff. We play LOT of strategy board games, this came naturally. Pros: easy to learn and setup, game ends fairly quickly compared to a game like monopoly, more strategy involved.
customer_reviews.author: Working mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: All the rules are a little confusing at first, but we quickly caught on. Our entire family ages 4-41 love this game. The little guys team up with adults giving the game an extra level of challenge. We received this for Christmas and have played it almost every night for the past 2 weeks. We also have the expansion pack to allow more to join in on the fun. The robber tends to create ill feelings and heartache, but such is life. It’s all fun and games until somebody gets robbed 😂😂😂 we recommend this game to anyone who loves games of strategy!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hathcock

customer_reviews.title: Great game for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Catan is a great strategy game. It’s well balanced — players at all skill levels will enjoy this game. Catan combines conquest with resource management and trading as players work to collect 10 Victory Points through tasks like building roads and cities, using knights to steal resources from other players, and controlling ports to maximize resource development. Games are long enough to be enjoyable but not so long that you need to clear your calendar.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harms

customer_reviews.title: it is a disaster
customer_reviews.text: all games board does not match each other in the game. i have been tried all different way, i could not do that. Also one of the orange stick is short. which game it can be disaster more then this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I played this years ago with some acquaintances it was really fun but I could never bring myself to pay full price. Got it on Black Friday for a Christmas family gift. My boys 14 & 7 played with me the other night. We had a great time. With my 7yr as a reading level it was really enjoyable for all of us we could play with minimal assistance. Set up was a challenge getting through all the rules but once we got started we had an enjoyable game night. Now the boys are interested in the expansions. Definitely will look into them and may even pay full price!
customer_reviews.author: Felipe J. Flores III

customer_reviews.title: Good game with balance of luck & lots of stratergies
customer_reviews.text: The game is very addictive. It will easily take 90+ minutes. If you have good players who tend to trade with you then the game moves faster or else it will take long.. also to learn several strategies related to the game, it will take good amount of practice. My 7 years old daughter even started studying them continuously for couple of days on how to maximize the resources!! The delivery was fast as promised. The quality of the materials is also good.
customer_reviews.author: Madhukara

customer_reviews.title: Board warped badly
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves this game, and we play it a lot. My problem with this game is that the board warped literally overnight. There are pieces that need to fit together and with the warping it is not a good fit anymore. We can still play it, but I really wish the board was made of some other sort of material that didn't react so extremely to humidity.
customer_reviews.author: CapWill

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this game but the one they received doesn't have ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this game as a gift for friends. We LOVE this game but the one they received doesn't have pieces that are cut correctly. The outer part of the game that forms the hex and has the ports never stays connected. It's very hard to play because as a result the hexes do not fit inside the hex correctly and during regular game play everything gets shifted and disconnected. It's so frustrating since we all love the game! :-( . The game itself is 10 stars but the one we received is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Danna S

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I've heard about this game for years. I saw it on an amazon deal and so I decided to pop for it. It's...good. Honestly I am not super duper impressed with the fun of it, but it's fast, pretty easy to learn, engaging enough, and overall not a bad game. I would play it again, but something about it doesn't really scratch that competitive itch I am used to with board games. I guess that's partly the point of Catan, though, right?
customer_reviews.author: David Demoss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent board game
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding game. we've quickly become quite addicted to Catan. This is a big hit w/ the family and everyone we have shared the game with. We've even bought a few copies for some others - GREAT present idea, also. Pros - the resource rules are well defined, game flow is very active for all players, every one has the chance of participating in every roll of the dice, you can be as friendly or not friendly to other players as you like and the game board allows.... Cons - We have found that it is unlikely go get a game done in 60 minutes though - seems that it takes 2 to 3 hrs for 4 to 6 players.
customer_reviews.author: Lego Man

customer_reviews.title: Classic Catan - worth the moderate learning curve
customer_reviews.text: We've been playing Catan for about three years. And finally getting a second set so our daughter can have one in college. If I was doing it all over again, I'd teach the family Catan much earlier in place of a few of those Sorry or throwaway Uno games.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Missing Cards
customer_reviews.text: This game came with two sets of one kind of card and no ore (mountain) cards! Can't even play it! After learning the rules and getting set to play, we could not do it. For the price of this game you should have all the correct cards!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Law Dog

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces - Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas and after some confusion we realized that we were missing all of the development cards making the game unplayable. The cards come in two packs that should presumably be different, but we received two identical decks that only contained resource cards. Also, all of the game board sections quickly started to warp (see photos). So, even if we had all the cards, it would be difficult to place settlements. The game is great, I've played "Settlers of Catan" before and I was hoping to play with my family, but the game that we received was incomplete and very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: DaveP

customer_reviews.title: Trade build settle
customer_reviews.text: One of the best board games for 3 to 4 players. It is really good to have when you go to a group outing, such as skiing or Hot Springs and need something to entertain you while in the mountains at night. We had always played a friends version which was the one before this addition, however there is no noticeable difference between the two. I think the quality of the box is good, it seems like it would hold up for 1000 years on a shelf, however the cardboard pieces inside seem to be of average quality. Overall, we love the game and therefore it deserves five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Check to make sure you have all the pieces.
customer_reviews.text: Love Catan, it's a great game... but I think I received a third-party product. The game board is cut badly. The pieces don't link up properly. I have to force them into place. I'm missing the robber, 1 white city, 1 orange city, and 1 red city. The orange and red pieces are so close in colour that it is hard to tell them apart when playing. The wooden roads are cut badly. They are not smooth, but rough on some sides. I have some settlements that are cracked as well. Please check all your pieces when you receive it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: It’s well known for a good reason!
customer_reviews.text: I originally played this for the first time about a month back and I t certainly helped having someone who already knew the rules. It may seem a little daunting but once the rules are established it flows nicely. This is a good strategy game with resource gathering to develop your settlements and obtain more resources than your counterparts to win the game. It is very dynamic and engaging for all players with a board that changes with every play-through. I really enjoyed it with my friends and see this in the rotation for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: A. Roessler

customer_reviews.title: Catan is incredible thought provoking board game where strategy and luck play an important roll in winning it all!
customer_reviews.text: What an incredible interactive game! It's about strategy and a lot of luck! One of the unique parts of the game is that the board can be re-arranged each time you play. We change it after each round to make it more interesting and fun. Then game is for 3-4 players. We've found that playing with 3 players is really fun and fast. Playing with 4 players is much more challenging and makes you think a lot more about your placement of your settlements and roads. It's so much fun and we really love playing it as much as we can! We highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amy B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game. a friend introduced me to it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game. a friend introduced me to it. very addicting. unfortunately, the game i received was poor quality. not the quality of my friend's game. missing pieces, the tiles don't lay flat, missing cards. very easy to return to amazon. i'm going to try another vendor.
customer_reviews.author: PMS33

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Beginner/Experienced Game!
customer_reviews.text: I used to play this game with my parents and our neighbors, and loved it. I bought this for my 13 year old brother, because of his interest in board games, and he was also able to enjoy it. Moral of the story is that I have watched people ages from 13-60 pour hours into this game over and over, and it remain a blast, and a fantastic game night staple. I also recommend buying expansions if you enjoy the base game!
customer_reviews.author: Torpedopocalypse

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality
customer_reviews.text: We love the game but, some of the wooden pieces are of different sizes and the outside perimeter pieces don't fit together properly. Disappointing for a game that costs $30. Realistically, this game must cost less than Monopoly to produce but costs more to buy. I've never seen a Monopoly game come with substandard pieces. Again, disappointing for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ronney Clement

customer_reviews.title: A Family Favorite
customer_reviews.text: This game has gone from fairly unknown to well known in the matter of years and for a good reason. This game is fun, and different each time you play it. My folks play it so much that their copy wore out, so I bought them another copy. I own this and several other versions to this game. My son, seeing how much we enjoy this game wanted to play, but being 7 he was too young, so we also got the CATAN Junior game, and he loves the pirate theme of that. This game is one my family plays pretty often.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn L.

customer_reviews.title: Probably my favorite game of all time.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this game and I cannot believe I’ve been hearing about it for years and only recently learned how to play. I got this one when I was on sale during Black Friday. One of the best things I’ve bought this year. Great investment. Seafarers is the next game I want to buy in the series, it’s expensive so I’m going to wait a little bit before investing more in this game. There’s not much time to play in college; it’s perfect for summer game nights! If you’re thinking of buying the game, just do it.
customer_reviews.author: Inna

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and challenging
customer_reviews.text: While this is not on the super top of my list of favorites, I like playing this game. The only time someone has said they hated it...is when 7s were rolled more than normal. When that happens, it can be rather miserable losing cards all the time. Has several strategy options to reach the point total. There is a small element of personal attack when you place the robber or steal cards from one player.
customer_reviews.author: Marcea Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great game. Not initially intuitive
customer_reviews.text: Great game. My son and I had to watch a few videos to figure out how to play the game. Yes, we read all the instructions but this is not an intuitive game. This is an awesome game. The board can be changed each game. A strategy that helped you win one game might cause you to lose the next. It is addictive and fun to play. I think 2-3 players is a good number to play with.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: If you've spent years not playing this game and just hearing your friends talk about it, now is the time to buy and learn how to play. Trust me, I spent probably 10 years listening to my friends talk about it and only thought to myself, " it's just a board game" but then I bought it, and it's amazing. Then check out the subreddit r/catan
customer_reviews.author: Sink

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to give it 1 star
customer_reviews.text: I had the 4th edition, and the layout of the 4th is way better than the 5th The box is finishing is great, and this is the only positive point The tiles print is shifted and not centered for few of them The roads are not equal, some are thinner, even one is broken! The players pieces are (blue, white, red and yellow) But the cards colors are (blue, white, red and orange) Why they are mismatched colors! Really disappointed with the new 5th editiin
customer_reviews.author: Bjairmi

customer_reviews.title: I don't think it's counterfeit, but quality still lacks
customer_reviews.text: My copy is 5th edition. I looked up counterfeit indicators, and didn't find any that seem to match on my copy, so I believe it to be original. Box quality, cardboard quality, no misspellings in the instructions, seem to be good. What I am not happy about is the fact that the punch-out pieces are cut off-center. This is most evident in the numbered tokens. This seems to be in line with what other people have said about the 5th edition quality having dropped off. Pretty sad. It's still playable, just not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: IAmAnAmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Completely defective, missing loads of components.
customer_reviews.text: The game came with entirely, wildly, incorrect sets of cards. It is supposed to have 19 of each of five resources. Instead had 35 lumber, 48 wool, only 3 brick, no ore cards at all, and 48 wheat. And no victory points or knights at all. In other words, the set we have received is worthless for any purpose.
customer_reviews.author: HPX

customer_reviews.title: Materials are not high quality.
customer_reviews.text: The game is fun; however the quality of the Catan materials are not great. for a $40 game the cardboard box should be nice and sturdy, the plastic holder on the inside should be thick and hefty, even the cards and wooden pieces and just of low quality. Especially when comparing this game to other $40 games we have (we love games in our household) this game just doesn't hold up to quality of all our other games. It's a shame that a company would go this cheap on the materials of this game.
customer_reviews.author: Adventurer

customer_reviews.title: Warning! This version is a ripped off production
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give negative starts. Catan rocks, highly recommend, but NOT FROM THIS RIP OFF SELLER! When I finally purchased my own game I was really disappointed to find the card board pieces printing was off and the orange wood pieces were yellow instead (they didn't bother to change the card color so they didn't match). Forgetting I purchased through Amazon, I contacted Catan directly and then again to say disregard, didn't buy through them. They wrote me back anyway to say that there's knock-off copies being sold on here and they've had zero luck getting Amazon to pull the game. Don't support these thieves.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Love this game!
customer_reviews.text: I started playing Catan when I was 21 and now my 5 and 8 year old know how to play too. Of all the board games I have played, this is definitely the best. Each game lasts about an hour with four players. After a while, you may want a bigger challenge so I'd recommend adding the Cities and Knights expansion.
customer_reviews.author: Benny T. Chow

customer_reviews.title: Build your empire
customer_reviews.text: I love Settlers of Catan! Great fun game that changes each time you play. Hours of fun. Does have a learning curve with knowing what cards to give to each player in a timely manner to not slow things down to a drag but once you have the hang of it, its fast paced. Highly recommend it! Great gift idea for that board game friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: wearwood

customer_reviews.title: Great gateway board game
customer_reviews.text: This was the first non standard board game I played and sucked me into the wonderful world of non MB/Parker brothers board games. I still find myself coming back to this game to play with newcomers to non-standard board games. I know a lot of people complain about the game but I feel like it is balanced pretty well and easy enough for anyone to pick up. Highly recommended everyone picks this game up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T

customer_reviews.title: We all agree!
customer_reviews.text: Not everyone in our house is competitive and that makes it difficult to find a game where we all retain interest. This one appeals to both competitive and collaborative personalities alike. You are trying to win, but you also need to stay in the good graces of your “neighbors.” We finally found a game we can all enjoy! It has quickly become a household favorite and even our couch potatoes have been known to want this game instead of TV time. 12 yr olds enjoying non-electronic-based family time? You heard me. I love that the add-on sets change the game a bit. That will keep everyone’s interest, too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Haggard

customer_reviews.title: Favorite game of all time
customer_reviews.text: Loved this game. We spend hours playing this game with friends and it is now among our favorite board games of all time. We try to experiment using the Catan Board generator apps and it makes the game more interesting. 4 stars for missing pieces. Robber piece was missing in this set. We ended up using the souvenirs in our home as the robber.
customer_reviews.author: Dk91er

customer_reviews.title: A game we actually play
customer_reviews.text: This game was selected by my 11 year old son. He had played it at a friends. We own very few board games as they tend to end slightly prematurely do to an argument. The rules of this game are clear, not overcomplicated, yet creative and varied enough to encourage cooperative fun play with few chances for disagreement. Unlike the few board games we own we have actually played this game on a regular basis, no dust has settled on it!! It does take some time but there are "quick play" variations to help along those with a shorter attention span. Anything that encourages harmony and togetherness in our busy household gets five stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: Best game ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game, truly no other can beat this one. The mysterious game play is so addictive, we got classic characters like Mr. Green, Miss. Scarlett, Mrs. Peacock, professor plum and many more! Finding clues to the murder mystery is amazing, 10/10 for me
customer_reviews.author: T. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Misaligned printing
customer_reviews.text: I picked up Catan from the Amazon Treasure Truck. The game is all here, but I'm pretty disappointed about the Building Cost cards- they are all misaligned on the printing. Like they were printed and cut too high up on the card. The blue card has orange on the bottom, and the red card has white on the bottom. And on the other cards the artwork seems to be cut off on the top. You can even tell on the back letters of the number cards that the printer seemed to be misaligned, the letters are all off center.
customer_reviews.author: Stinky Toes

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Game
customer_reviews.text: Catan is an awesome game. My 10 year old son is able to play it with us. My husband who doesn't like most games, loves this game. It's very re-playable. The layout changes each game and there are lots of expansions for it. We also bought the Cities and Knights expansion and that is all we ever play now. It makes it more complex. You can try different strategies. You play against the other players.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great for family and friends
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this game and have started playing on numerous nights with friends. If you have 3 or more people in your house that need some entertainment go for it. I also like that most games last just around an hour or so, this way you can usually place twice in a night. We have about 20 friends who have played and they all love the game.
customer_reviews.author: Savannahgreenexo

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit skeptical seeing some reviews about it not being real, but played a game the other day, and all the pieces were there, everything fit well, so it seems authentic to me? Maybe some people got bad batches? The game itself is great, best to play it with someone who knows what they are doing first.
customer_reviews.author: oioi123

customer_reviews.title: He's almost 25 years old and this is his favorite board game
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for our son-in-law for Christmas. He's almost 25 years old and this is his favorite board game. He and our daughter taught our family how to play it over the Christmas holiday--it's deceptively simple yet challenging and competitive and different every time you play it . Fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.author: bikenski

customer_reviews.title: Good fun game the does not last to long.
customer_reviews.text: We got this game about 2 Months ago. Games are usually lasting 45 min to 1 1/3 hours. We don’t always want to spend 2 to 4 hours playing Monopoly. My kids are 12 and 14 and both love to play. We have been playing 2 to 5 games a week. It may not be a high level strategy game, but it is fun. We look forward to getting other variations.
customer_reviews.author: ILove2Shoot

customer_reviews.title: He has always loved this game
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my husband for Christmas. He made my brothers and me play with him immediately (which is uncharacteristic as he is very compliant) and would not permit us our usual joking, inattention, and cell phones (of which he is often the center). He has always loved this game, and despite my short attention span, I picked up on it fast. The rules are detailed but the strategy is simple and fun. If you like Monopoly or Ticket to Ride, you will enjoy it. I also purchased a copy of the Seafarers Expansion. And delivery was, of course, speedy and easy for me :) Thank you, BLW Associates West, LLC.
customer_reviews.author: Klupton

customer_reviews.title: Great Game.. Missin' Roads
customer_reviews.text: Its a game that will for sure make you all gather around. If you play this be warned that it totally can take a whole nights worth of game play. I would suggest drinking once it hits 9 o clock so hopefully someone flips the board at 12:30 .. Sadly our Catan didnt come with roads at ALL so we have been trying to figure out a good replacement. if any suggestions let us know
customer_reviews.author: Courteney bee

customer_reviews.title: Stay Home and play
customer_reviews.text: A really fun game overall. A little difficult to learn, but the directions are clear. This game takes anywhere from an hour to two to play. You do need at least three to play, and it is more fun with four. (Rivals for Catan is a two player version which is just as fun.) One of the things I like best about playing is that it is a great balance between luck and skill. You are never truly rolling the dice for just yourself, but your strategy does matter.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: I had read good things about this game and it’s many expansions. Due to being quarantined and needing things to do, I decided to give this a whirl. The rules are fairly complicated at first, however, halfway thru the first round it became simple and easy. Recommend for families and friends!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Fun, get the additional box for groups over 4.
customer_reviews.text: This is a 4-player game, to do 5 players you can buy an additional kit. I have added the kit, the only negative is having to re-sort the contents after you've played 6 players and later want to do 4 players. It is a really fun game, takes a few plays to understand the benefits and drawbacks of placing your roads and buildings.
customer_reviews.author: bridgette egly

customer_reviews.title: Great update to a classic game
customer_reviews.text: My family is a big fan of board games and Catan has been at the top of our "most played" list for years. Our old game (and old design) was loved so well that the cards and board pieces got worn down (not because of a manufacturing or quality problem) so we recently had to get a new one. The newer updated version looks nice and clean. This one is more animated than realistic like the old one. Other than your preference on the old or new design, there is nothing not to like about this game. It will be well loved just like our previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Uplander

customer_reviews.title: We are having so much fun playing this game as a family!!
customer_reviews.text: We are having so much fun playing this game as a family!! Our daughter first played this last spring on the DCL Wonder Ship in the teen club "The Vibe" She even got awarded the "Catan Queen" from the counselors!! It is not difficult to play but the strategy is a lille harder to get it figured out! It takes less than an hour on average to play, usually we wish it lasted longer and often play several games after dinner! There is even an App available for IOS and other platforms for learning this game!
customer_reviews.author: My Kids Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very exciting and engaging after spending a couple of rounds learning.
customer_reviews.text: Catan is a new challenge each time you play. It requires fresh problem solving and new strategies each time you play. It looks overwhelming to learn, but slowly playing a couple of times while consulting the really helpful game directions makes it al clear pretty quickly. We spent most evening playing this over winter break (we are two teens and two adults) because it's exciting and thrilling and a fresh game each time.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Russell

customer_reviews.title: I love this game
customer_reviews.text: I love this game, so I was excited that it was on sale around the holidays so I could gift it to my girlfriend. I personally like the 4th edition a bit better, how the pieces fit together and how they look, but probably just because that's the version I've always had. This is a great game and once you get the rules and strategy down, you can get through a four-person game in 30 to 45 minutes. It definitely makes you think about strategy a lot and is always interesting because the game board is always a little different so you have to change your strategy based on the resources available to you. Great game, I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Davies

customer_reviews.title: Love the game, but QA is suspect
customer_reviews.text: The game itself is fine, but new out of the box we were missing 6 pieces. We had to supplement with pieces from another game. I've contacted the manufacturer. Let's see how they address the problem. ★★ [UPDATE] There's a form to fill out on the official website to help address missing pieces, so I guess I'm not the first person with this problem. They shipped fast (3 days) and now the game is as it should have been right out of the packaging. Better late than never. Make sure you check your pieces before you play! ★★★★
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: One of the best syra
customer_reviews.text: At first it is a little hard to learn to play but it is worth learning. It is a lot of fun and it always keeps you guessing as to what's going to happen next. When you first start it is easier to learn with three people. Once you know how to play then start with four people. Four makes it more challenging and fun! This is a great game!!
customer_reviews.author: Luvmypenguins

customer_reviews.title: great game but some quality control issues in ours
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love Catan. We've played on older editions before. Why did they have to redo the graphics on the tiles and cards? They have a solid game, just stick with it. Also, one our city pieces came missing most of its bottom. There wasn't a broken piece in the bag so it didn't break during shipping or anything. Still usable but could use some better quality control. I'm still giving this 5 stars as it is our favorite game at the moment despite the issues with the 5th edition.
customer_reviews.author: P. Robichaux

customer_reviews.title: Defective and no quality control
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately when I opened my game long after purchasing it there were a bunch of broken pieces, the board itself doesn't actually connect together which makes playing very difficult. There just isn't any quality to the game, and many of my friends have it and theirs are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Neille

customer_reviews.title: Board Game Classic!
customer_reviews.text: I love Catan! We got this for $20 around Thanksgiving and it was totally and completely worth it--been waiting for the price to drop for AGES now. The art is a little bit different than the Catan I first played a few years back (when it was called "Settlers of Catan." The colors are beautiful and the board is great quality. The game is fun and a total classic. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: GDGK

customer_reviews.title: How did I not know about this game?!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the BEST strategy games I've played in a long time. It may seem overwhelming at first- but once you get the hang of it you'll want to play regularly. It's a fantastic group game- and for an even larger party you can purchase expansion packs!! And although this game is for at least three players- my boyfriend and I have managed to figure out a way to play with just the two of us (we start out with 3 settlements and allow for a larger amount of points in order to win the game). It really gets you thinking and using that logic/strategy part of your brain!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Echevarria

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to learn but so much fun to play!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! It's the perfect game for two and more people to play, and it was a great find since I had heard about this game from friends. The only setback is that the process of learning how to play is a little bit difficult. We had to spend some time into reading the manual, and had to look at it over and over while we played. I have played multiple times and I had a lot of fun! I will admit that at the beginning, I kind of felt overwhelmed by the amount of information needed to play. But it definitely felt rewarding after reaching the learning curve!
customer_reviews.author: andrew chon

customer_reviews.title: Best Board Game Ever
customer_reviews.text: To me BEST board game ever. It's easy to learn, you can modify it how ever you want, it has its own expansions too, and you can resize the game which ever way you want. Catan deserves its name. WARNING some of the Catan boxes may be counterfeit I dont know how it happened but Asmodee confirmed that my first purchase was in fact counterfeit, so Amazon sent me a replacement, make sure your box is original.
customer_reviews.author: Bookman73

customer_reviews.title: Do you have wood for my sheep?
customer_reviews.text: The first time I played this game, I had a blast. I typically don't find much enjoyment with board games, as I get board fast playing them. However, after playing this at a friend's house I wanted to have a copy on hand for when I had friends over. I could only ever find it at stores marked way up in price. So I would get my fix playing mobile versions of the game on my phone. Finally snagged this on an Amazon sale, and try to introduce all my friends and family to it. Plus we all giggle like middle schoolers when someone asks if someone has wood for their sheep.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money. Love this game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome! It is made out of high quality materials. At first the game came missing key pieces to play, and I was rather disappointed, but the return and replacement process with Amazon was amazingly fast. They overnighted my replacement game. My seven year old is pretty bright and plays this game with me any chance we get. You build settlements, roads and cities. As you build you collect grains, wool, Orr, brick and wood which helps your settlements grow. Just as long as the robber doesn't slow you down too bad! Worth the money. I also recommend the expansion kits.
customer_reviews.author: Mardi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite games I have ever played! The rules aren't too complex and it is easy to play with a few or a lot of people. I had previously bought the family edition but the 5th edition offers way more expandable play, as well as being comparable with the expansion packs which the family edition is not. Over all this is a well made product and a absolute must for anyone who enjoys board games.
customer_reviews.author: Albatross Jhones

customer_reviews.title: VERY Fun, addictive game!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge board game person but do like playing games. We'd been wanting to get Catan but had been putting it off. I finally pulled the trigger and am SO glad I did! It's such a fun game, and IMO, is the perfect length. The game doesn't last hours and hours like other board games, but last long enough to allow the players to get invested in the game! I would HIGHLY recommend Catan, and we are already looking at getting some of the expansions!
customer_reviews.author: Julienne V.

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite games!
customer_reviews.text: Catan is one of my favorite games, so I finally bought this for myself. The cards and pieces look a little different than previous versions, but it is still the exact same game. I also noticed that the board pieces were cut slightly smaller than other versions, I assume in attempts to make the pieces fit in the frame better. Because of this, the board pieces were able to move around slightly within the outer frame, but for me that was much less annoying than the pieces popping out from being slightly too large. This is a must-have game for any game night!
customer_reviews.author: bighpfan

customer_reviews.title: Fun board game
customer_reviews.text: Not too difficult, but with enough strategy to keep people entertained for a long time. Max 4 players which is a bummer, but there are expansion packs for an extra cost. Like monopoly it may cause friction between friends and family because of the competitive nature of the game Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Valentin Anghel

customer_reviews.title: We love this game
customer_reviews.text: My sisters and our boyfriends love playing this game whwnever we get a day to hang out. We are in our low to mid 20's. It has the potential for a lot of strategy but you dont have to have any to play decently. We learned it in a single play and have improved our play every time since. Weve been playing for about 3 months now and thuroughly enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Powell

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, try and find an older edition.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace our old, well loved, but falling apart Settler's of Catan. Unfortunately the quality of this game just isn't as good as the old version. The frame of the board doesn't fit together well and makes it difficult to play. Some of the wood pieces came broken or misformed. And the colors of the wood peices in the this game and the expansion pack don't match! If i didn't need a replacement for my old game so badly, I would return this one... Dissappointing, I thought the "new" version was supposed to be an improvement
customer_reviews.author: E. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Endless fun
customer_reviews.text: SO MUCH FUN! This game is a fun strategy game and we have played for hours and hours. We have also bought as gifts for most of our family. Good for older kids/adults. We have found that the games last anywhere from 45 minutes to 1.5 hours. We love that the board is different every time you set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Best gate way board game
customer_reviews.text: This game brought me back the passion for board game after many years. Its mechanics are great, even though it has a bit of dice luck (which does not bother me at all). It's a classical for a reason, IT IS VERY GOOD. People get addicted to it and almost always want to play it again. Good replayability since the board can change every game, Easy to learn and it has the card trade aspect which allows nice interaction between players. The only thing I would want is the ability to play with two players.
customer_reviews.author: GcgGaldi

customer_reviews.title: Authentic?
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if I got an authentic Catan. The printing of the instructions were off. And some tiles are bent so it’s a bit difficult to put it together on the table. I think I bought it from a third party seller. I collect boardgames so this is a disappointment. But the game is a classic. Just questioning the authenticity of the delivered product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Addictive!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for boyfriend for christmas! He loved it and now his whole family is hooked! Makes a great gift and theres 5 expansion packs! Each expansion has a mini expansion in it to keep increasing your number of players! Intricate yet easy to remember to play! Lost of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent board game
customer_reviews.text: Catan is a very fun, family board game. There is a lot to it, but after a couple play throughs, it starts to make sense and you have an idea of what you're doing. This game is for up to four players, with available expansion to increase total number of players to 6. Be careful, you may say some mean things to family members.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: Although I have not opened this game yet I very much enjoyed playing with out of state family a few months ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Although I have not opened this game yet I very much enjoyed playing with out of state family a few months ago. I am excited to get to play again. I would liken it to kind of medieval Monopoly. However the game does not last near as long. It has multiple Editions to keep the game new and exciting. And expansions which I also bought to include more players. If you like board games with a little bit of luck of the draw as well as some strategy this is a fun game.
customer_reviews.author: Angie H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for older kids and adults.
customer_reviews.text: Catan offers bartering and interaction, in addition to strategy and chance. Even when it is not your turn, you are still involved in the action. I can see this game being played by our family for a long time. Both teenagers enjoy it and so do the parents. It does take a little over an hour to play. That means it takes a bit of a commitment to start, but the result is quality time together. The play might be too complicated for younger children to enjoy. I would estimate children under 10 or 12 would need guidance to make good decisions and stay competitive at least for the first several games.
customer_reviews.author: Polly Nine

customer_reviews.title: Best game ever
customer_reviews.text: Best game ever. Don't read any further. Just buy the game and enjoy. My one recommendation would be to find someone that knows how to play and have them teach you the rules. Initially the rules may appear daunting and complex, but once you get a feel for the game, you will realize the rules are quite simple and the game play moves quickly (games last about an hour). My 8 year old loves the game, but is at the lower bound of the age group capable of understanding and playing Catan. For the older folks, there are drinking game rules that can be found online... Catan!
customer_reviews.author: T.Kobus

customer_reviews.title: Fun, challenging game!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this game. The pieces all came in the correct amount. 1 of the little houses was a little too short, but everything else was wonderful in the game. I would take this into my classroom and play with 2nd-high schoolers. Easy to learn, but there is a lot to remember. Fun if you stick to it and actually learn to play!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R. Mendoza

product_meta.title: Catan The Board Game, Multicolor
product_meta.description: Your adventurous settlers seek to tame the remote but rich isle of Catan. Start by revealing Catan’s many harbors and regions: Pastures, fields, mountains, hills, forests, and desert. The random mix creates a different board virtually every game. Skills - Clever trading, strategy, tactical skill, luck. Type of Game: War games. To play with 5–6 players, the 5–6 player extension is required.
feature_bullets: The incredibly popular, multi award winning civilization building board game of harvesting and trading resources
Players control their own civilization and look to spread across a modular hex board in a competition for victory points
Beware the robber’s nefarious plans as he steals resources and plunders the wealthy
3 to 4 players, 60 minutes, ages over 10. To play with 5–6 players, the 5–6 player extension is required.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars9,103 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
